Distance

Submodules

commonroad_crime.measure.distance.dce module

class commonroad_crime.measure.distance.dce.DCE(config: CriMeConfiguration)[source]

Bases: CriMeBase

J. Eggert, “Predictive risk estimation for intelligent ADAS functions,” in 17th International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSC), pp. 711–718, IEEE, 2014.

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem
compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0, verbose: bool = True)[source]

Computed the shortest distance of ego-vehicle and obstacle by calculating the distance between both polygons (boundaries of both objects) for each time step and returning the minimum.

ego_vehicle: DynamicObstacle
measure_name: Enum = 'distance-of-closest-encounter'
monotone: Enum = 'negative monotonic'
other_vehicle: Union[Obstacle, DynamicObstacle, StaticObstacle, None]
rnd: Union[MPRenderer, None]
visualize(figsize: tuple = (25, 15))[source]

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.
